coupon.conditions.rules.usage: Each coupon is valid once per partner â€“ you can redeem discounts with multiple providers, but only once at a given location.
coupon.conditions.rules.groupIntro: Some discounts cover the whole group, others just one person â€“ see the details next to each offer:

coupon.conditions.rules.groupStay.html: âœ… Lefkara accommodation â€“15% or â€“20% is calculated from the total stay price.

coupon.conditions.rules.named: The coupon is personal and indivisible â€“ you can't split one discount between several transactions.
coupon.conditions.rules.show: Show the coupon before using the service â€“ on your phone or printed out.
coupon.conditions.rules.combine: Discounts can't be combined with other promos or codes â€“ the better option applies.
coupon.conditions.rules.verify: Partners may verify coupon validity â€“ once used, the discount is marked as redeemed.
coupon.conditions.rules.cash: Coupons can't be exchanged for cash â€“ they are a bonus, not a payment method.

packing.season.spring.label: Spring
packing.season.spring.summary: Mild days (17â€“28Â°C) and crisp evenings. Pack layers and light protection for passing showers.
packing.season.summer.label: Summer
packing.season.summer.summary: Heat above 30Â°C, the sea warms to 26â€“27Â°C and rain is rare. Focus on lightweight clothes and strong sun protection.
packing.season.autumn.label: Autumn
packing.season.autumn.summary: September stays hot, while October and November bring pleasant 21â€“30Â°C. The sea remains warm and rain usually appears late in the season.
packing.season.winter.label: Winter
packing.season.winter.summary: Coastal days reach 15â€“18Â°C with cool nights and possible snow in the Troodos mountains. Itâ€™s the rainy seasonâ€”pack layers and waterproof outerwear.
packing.guide.universal.title: Universal essentials
packing.guide.seasonal.title: Seasonal additions
packing.guide.universal.documents.label: ID card or passport
packing.guide.universal.documents.hint: A passport is useful if you plan to enter Northern Cyprus.
packing.guide.universal.bookings.label: Tickets, vouchers and reservation copies
packing.guide.universal.bookings.hint: Keep them in both digital and printed form just in case.
packing.guide.universal.insurance.label: Travel insurance and EHIC card
packing.guide.universal.insurance.hint: EHIC works in the south; you will need private care in the north.
packing.guide.universal.money.label: Payment cards and cash in euros
packing.guide.universal.money.hint: Not everywhere accepts cards, so carry spare banknotes and coins.
packing.guide.universal.driving.label: Driving licence and extra car insurance
packing.guide.universal.driving.hint: Check the rules for driving to the north when renting a car.
packing.guide.universal.electronics.labe: Smartphone with offline maps, charger and power bank
packing.guide.universal.electronics.hint: Save important contacts and keep enough power for a full day of exploring.
packing.guide.universal.adapter.label: Type G plug adapter
packing.guide.universal.adapter.hint: Cyprus uses the British 240 V standard with three rectangular pins.
packing.guide.universal.firstAid.label: Basic first aid kit and toiletries
packing.guide.universal.firstAid.hint: Prescription medicine, painkillers, anti-diarrhoea and motion sickness remedies, plus mosquito spray.
packing.guide.universal.sunProtection.hi: SPF 30â€“50 sunscreen, UV sunglasses and a hat are needed throughout the year.
packing.guide.universal.daypack.label: Day backpack, water bottle and luggage lock
packing.guide.universal.daypack.hint: Stay hydrated and keep your belongings secure on excursions.
packing.guide.universal.comfort.label: Travel comfort accessories
packing.guide.universal.comfort.hint: Earplugs, sleep mask and travel pillow make flights or night journeys more comfortable.
packing.guide.seasons.spring.layers.labe: Layered T-shirts and a light jacket
packing.guide.seasons.spring.layers.hint: Days are pleasantly warm, but mornings and evenings get cooler.
packing.guide.seasons.spring.longSleeves: Long trousers and a long-sleeve sweatshirt
Ideal in early March and for trips to the mountains.
packing.guide.seasons.spring.shoes.label: Comfortable trainers or hiking shoes
packing.guide.seasons.spring.shoes.hint: Perfect for lush Troodos trails and archaeological sites.
packing.guide.seasons.spring.sunAccessor: Spring sunshine can be intense while sightseeing.
packing.guide.seasons.spring.sunscreen.h: Protect your skin even when temperatures feel moderate.
packing.guide.seasons.spring.scarf.label: Light scarf or shawl
packing.guide.seasons.spring.scarf.hint: Shields your neck from the sun and warms you during cooler evenings.
packing.guide.seasons.spring.swimwear.hi: By May the sea reaches about 20Â°C and many hotels heat their pools.
packing.guide.seasons.spring.rainProtect: Compact umbrella or thin rain jacket
Passing showers are common at the beginning of spring.
packing.guide.seasons.spring.camera.labe: Camera or phone with free storage
packing.guide.seasons.spring.camera.hint: Capture Cyprus in bloomâ€”it is at its most photogenic now.
packing.guide.seasons.summer.swimwear.hi: Rotate them without waiting for one to dry.
packing.guide.seasons.summer.towel.label: Quick-dry beach towel or pareo
packing.guide.seasons.summer.towel.hint: Works both at the seaside and by the hotel pool.
packing.guide.seasons.summer.clothing.hi: Cotton and linen handle 30Â°C+ heat best.
packing.guide.seasons.summer.footwear.hi: Pack comfy trainers too for longer outings.
packing.guide.seasons.summer.sunscreen.h: Apply generously and reapply after every swim.
packing.guide.seasons.summer.hat.label: Wide-brim hat and UV sunglasses
packing.guide.seasons.summer.hat.hint: Protects your head and eyes from heat stroke.
packing.guide.seasons.summer.afterSun.hi: Soothes the skin after a long day under the sun.
packing.guide.seasons.summer.bottle.hint: Keeps drinks cool and reminds you to hydrate regularly.
packing.guide.seasons.summer.waterproofC: Waterproof case for phone and electronics
Shields equipment from sand and water during sports.
packing.guide.seasons.summer.coverUp.lab: Light cover-up or shirt for evenings
packing.guide.seasons.summer.coverUp.hin: Useful in the breeze or in air-conditioned rooms.
packing.guide.seasons.autumn.eveningLaye: Light jacket or sweater for evenings
October and November nights get cooler, especially by the sea.
packing.guide.seasons.autumn.trekkingSho: Great for Akamas and Troodos excursions in autumn.
packing.guide.seasons.autumn.sandals.lab: Flip-flops or sandals for the beach
packing.guide.seasons.autumn.sandals.hin: The sea stays pleasantly warm even in November.
packing.guide.seasons.autumn.sunAccessor: The autumn sun still shines strongly.
packing.guide.seasons.autumn.sunscreen.h: UV levels remain high despite lower air temperatures.
packing.guide.seasons.autumn.swimwear.hi: Beaches are quieter and the sea still invites you in.
packing.guide.seasons.autumn.camera.hint: Vineyards and the Troodos mountains glow golden.
packing.guide.seasons.autumn.rainProtect: Late October can bring the first showers.
packing.guide.seasons.winter.coat.label: Warm coat or jacket
packing.guide.seasons.winter.coat.hint: A lighter one suits the coast, but mountains need winterwear.
packing.guide.seasons.winter.layers.labe: Layered sweaters, hoodies and long trousers
packing.guide.seasons.winter.layers.hint: Helps you adapt to rapidly changing weather.
packing.guide.seasons.winter.boots.label: Ankle boots with non-slip soles
packing.guide.seasons.winter.boots.hint: Protect from rain and slippery surfaces.
packing.guide.seasons.winter.rainProtect: Winter is the rainiest period on the island.
packing.guide.seasons.winter.accessories: Essential in the mountains and on windy days.
Winter sun can dazzle, especially after rain or on snow.
packing.guide.seasons.winter.equipmentPl: If you ski on Olympus you can rent the heavier equipment locally.

places.kato-pafos-archaeological-park.de: Expansive UNESCO site with famous mosaics and the ruins of the ancient city of Nea Paphos.

places.coral-bay.description: Golden sand, gentle entry into the sea and crystal-clear waterâ€”the classic spot to relax near Peyia.
places.aphrodite-rock.name: Aphrodite's Rock (Petra tou Romiou)
places.aphrodite-rock.description: Legend says Aphrodite was born among the turquoise waves at this rockâ€”a perfect sunset viewpoint.
places.blue-lagoon-akamas.name: Blue Lagoon (Akamas)
places.blue-lagoon-akamas.description: Crystal-clear bay surrounded by the wild nature of the Akamas peninsulaâ€”a snorkelling paradise.
places.kourion-archaeological-site.name: Kourion Archaeological Site
places.kourion-archaeological-site.descr: Clifftop ruins of an ancient city with a theatre, baths and mosaics from the House of Eustolios.
places.kolossi-castle.name: Kolossi Castle
places.kolossi-castle.description: 13th-century Hospitaller fortress that once oversaw the production of Commandaria sweet wine.

places.molos-promenade.description: Seaside park lined with palms, sculptures and cafÃ©sâ€”the residents' favourite stroll in Limassol.

places.amathus-ruins.description: Remains of one of Cyprus' royal cities with an agora, Temple of Aphrodite and early Christian basilica.
places.limassol-castle.name: Limassol Castle (Medieval Museum)
places.limassol-castle.description: Stone castle in the heart of the old town, now home to a collection of medieval artefacts.
places.saint-lazarus-church.name: Church of Saint Lazarus in Larnaca
places.saint-lazarus-church.description: 9th-century stone church built over Saint Lazarus' tomb, famed for its ornate iconostasis.
places.larnaca-salt-lake-hala-sultan.nam: Larnaca Salt Lake and Hala Sultan Tekke
places.larnaca-salt-lake-hala-sultan.des: Winter flamingos and the mystical Hala Sultan Tekke mosque shape a unique lakeside landscape.
places.finikoudes-beach.name: Finikoudes Beach in Larnaca
places.finikoudes-beach.description: City beach with a palm-lined promenade, lively cafÃ©s and a gentle entry into the sea.
places.chirokitia-archaeological-site.de: UNESCO-listed Neolithic settlement with reconstructions of circular stone dwellings.
places.lefkara-village.name: Lefkara Village
places.lefkara-village.description: Mountain village famed for lefkaritiko lace and silver handicrafts in stone houses.
places.nissi-beach.name: Nissi Beach (Ayia Napa)
places.nissi-beach.description: Bright sand, shallow lagoon and the Nissi islet make it an icon of leisure and water sports.
places.cape-greco.name: Cape Greco
places.cape-greco.description: National park of cliffs, sea caves and the famous natural Bridge of Lovers.
places.fig-tree-bay.name: Fig Tree Bay Beach (Protaras)
places.fig-tree-bay.description: Azure bay with golden sand and a solitary fig tree symbolising the area.
places.ayia-napa-monastery.name: Ayia Napa Monastery

places.ayia-napa-sculpture-park.name: Ayia Napa Sculpture Park
places.ayia-napa-sculpture-park.descript: Open-air art gallery with over a hundred sculptures overlooking the sea and a neighbouring cactus park.
places.troodos-olympos.name: Mount Olympus (Olympos)
places.troodos-olympos.description: Cyprus' highest peak with the Artemis trail in summer and ski slopes in winter.

places.st-hilarion-castle.name: St Hilarion Castle
places.st-hilarion-castle.description: Mountain fortress spread across three rocky levels with legendary coastal views.

places.aphrodites-baths.description: Romantic natural pool on the Akamas peninsula linked to the legend of Aphrodite.

places.buffavento-castle.description: Hilltop castle ruins overlooking the Mediterranean, near the St Hilarion stronghold.

places.lania-village.description: Picturesque settlement at the foot of Troodos known for winemaking, galleries and a tranquil pace.

places.trooditissa-monastery.description: Mountain monastery in the Troodos range surrounded by forests, icons and pilgrims.
